newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Bond issues by S.Korean firms rise in 1996.
newsitem.headline: Bond issues by S.Korean firms rise in 1996.

text.p: South Korean companies raised 15.26 trillion won through bond issues in calendar 1996, up from 12.35 trillion in 1995, the Bank of Korea said on Thursday.
The figures are total bond issues minus repayments for maturing bonds, a bank official said.
But funds raised by issuing shares fell to 5.05 trillion won in 1996 from 6.16 trillion won in 1995, reflecting a slump on the Seoul stock market, the central bank said in a statment.
Rights issues totalled 3.65 trillion won in 1996, down sharply from 5.58 trillion won, but initial public offerings more than doubled to 1.39 trillion won from 580.1 billion won.
